items.title: Character Knowledge
items.content: What would my character know about this situation?

items.title: Skills and Tools
items.content: What skills or tools do I have that might be useful here?

items.title: Environment
items.content: How can I use the environment to my advantage?

items.title: Goals and Motivations
items.content: What are my character's goals and motivations in this moment?

items.title: Test Your Limits
items.content: Try an action that's just a bit out of your comfort zone. Whether it's a difficult social encounter or a risky physical stunt, pushing your limits can reveal hidden strengths.

items.title: Look for Patterns and Signs
items.content: Pay attention to recurring symbols, colors, or phrases in your surroundings. They might not mean much at first, but could hint at a mystery or a larger plot at work.

items.title: Plan a Character Moment
items.content: Think about a moment that defines your characterâ€”what would they do if pushed to an emotional limit? Acting on that impulse can bring depth to your roleplaying and change the current situation.

items.title: Gather Local Folklore
items.content: In any town or village, talk to elders or minstrels about local legends or ghost stories. This can spur you to explore mysterious sites or heed warnings that shape your next move.

items.title: Connect with the Environment Spiritually
items.content: Try a moment of quiet reflection or "communion" with the land, which might reveal subtle hints about upcoming dangers or rewards.

items.title: Tap into Seasonal Activities
items.content: Whether it's harvesting a crop, joining in a local winter festival, or chasing autumn leaves, seasonal events can offer fresh inspiration. These activities are not only fun but can also connect you to the community.
